definition: mint/CL:座[zuo4]
to make/to build/to manufacture/to invent/to fabricate/to go to/party (in a lawsuit or legal agreement)/crop/classifier for crops
money/coins/currency/silk
factory/yard/depot/workhouse/works/(industrial) plant

sentences.english: They create an optical illusion that the Mint hopes is almost impossible to duplicate.
sentences.chinese: 他們有一種錯覺，造幣廠覺得這幾乎是不可能複製的。

sentences.english: CHINA. Kwangtung. Heaton Mint at Birmingham Specimen Set, 1888 (1890). Heaton Mint at Birmingham.
sentences.chinese: 1888年英國伯明翰喜敦造幣廠樣幣一套。

sentences.english: I had a cousin who worked in the U. S. Mint.
sentences.chinese: 我有個表兄弟在美國造幣廠工作。

sentences.english: Economy the poor man's mints; extravagance the rich man's pitfall.(Martin Tupper.
sentences.chinese: 節約是窮人的造幣廠，浪費是富人的陷阱。

sentences.english: Economy is the poor man' s mint; and extravagance the rich man ' s pitfall.
sentences.chinese: 節省是貧平易近的造幣廠，華侈是富翁的陷阱。

sentences.english: The Royal Mint will strike a commemorative gold coin.
sentences.chinese: 英國皇家造幣廠將鑄造一種紀念金幣。
造幣廠正在鑄造每枚價值一便士的硬幣。

sentences.english: The mint have decide to issue the coin next year.
sentences.chinese: 這家造幣廠已決定明年發行硬幣。

sentences.english: Economy the poor man's mints; extravagance the rich man's pitfall. (Martin Tupper. American economist. )
sentences.chinese: 節省是貧平易近的造幣廠，華侈是富人的陷阱。

flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀元|银元/silver dollar
silver coinage
Governor of Guangdong and Guangxi
Yuan Shikai (1859-1916), senior general of late Qing, subsequently warlord and self-proclaimed emperor of China
flat silver (former coinage)/also written 銀圓|银圆/silver dollar
Tongmenghui, Sun Yat-sen's alliance for democracy, founded 1905, became the Guomindang 國民黨|国民党 in 1912
the three provinces of Northeast China, namely: Liaoning Province 遼寧省|辽宁省[Liao2 ning2 Sheng3], Jilin Province 吉林省[Ji2 lin2 Sheng3] and Heilongjiang Province 黑龍江省|黑龙江省[Hei1 long2 jiang1 Sheng3]
Taiping Heavenly Kingdom (1851-1864)
reign name of penultimate Qing emperor Guangxu or Guang-hsu (1875-1908)
Imperial Household Department (in Qing dynasty)
to weave/to manufacture by weaving
fractional currency (coin or note of value smaller than the country's unit of currency)/token (used instead of money for slot machines etc)
Matteo Ricci (1552-1610), Jesuit missionary and translator in Ming China
specialized school/college for professional training/polytechnic
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
